page.title: 15POPULATION
page.content:
In the 1981 census the population of the Parish of Okeford Fitzpaine was 634 people. Approximately 450 people lived in the main part of the village, and there were about 145 people aged 16 or under,while 19% were of pensionable age.
Quite a lot of families have lived in the village for generations. Corben, Ridout and Trowbridge are all common local names which occur in the records over centuries. However, since about 1980, a lot of people have moved into the village from further afield. Many of these have retired to the village.
Apart from the main village the population is sparse, with isolated farms and tiny hamlets.
